document_data.name: Air Elemental Myrmidon
document_data.mainbody: '''Air elemental myrmidons''', otherwise known as '''air myrmidons''' or '''air archons''', were a variety of [[elemental myrmidon]], beings created by conjuring and bonding [[elemental]]s — in this case of [[elemental air]] — into ritually created armor. They acted as servile weapons of war.{{MyrmidonArchon-Connection}}
document_data.Description:
Air myrmidons were beings composed entirely of elemental air, with bodies that were roughly [[human]] in size and shape.

Like all elemental myrmidons, they wore thick armor, typically of a [[plate mail|plate]] variety.{{Cite dragon/361/Ecology of the Fire Archon|45}} Their armor was all that would remain of them when killed.
document_data.Combat:
The standard variety of air myrmidon, zephyrhaunts, typically fought with [[spiked chain]]s or a [[flail]] with spikes on its chain. While those known as tempestblades typically fought with [[longsword]]s. Sometimes these were imbued with electrical energy, but regardless of what weapon an air myrmidon used, it was considered [[magic item|magical]].

They typically used hit-and-run tactics. Assaulting their enemies with a barrage of strikes before harrying away to attack another target, as well as maneuvering their adversaries into flanked positions.

document_data.History:
{{main|Elemental myrmidon#History}}

During the [[Elemental Evil]] crisis, air myrmidons and their variants were utilized by members of one of the four elemental cults responsible for the crisis, the [[Cult of the Howling Hatred]].

Varieties.Zephyrhaunts: The term used for the basic variety of air myrmidon. They were often employed for work as [[assassin]]s.
Varieties.Tempestblades: One of the more powerful varieties of air myrmidons. They often served as vanguards in battles.

Society.Creation:
Some said that constructing an elemental archon required a special foundry, with a special forge built in a significant concentration of elemental energy,{{Cite dragon/361/Ecology of the Fire Archon|42}} and a summoning crucible that served as the transformation space. These forges rarely appeared like a common forge, being unrecognizable contraptions of [[arcane magic|arcane]] and [[elemental magic]].

A working foundry could produce them as often as the ritual could be performed and for as long as the foundry's resources were maintained. The forge's power determine what kind of myrmidon was created.{{Cite dragon/361/Ecology of the Fire Archon|44}} A forge with ebbing power could only generate the most basic of air myrmidons, while those at high flow could produce more powerful varieties,{{Cite dragon/361/Ecology of the Fire Archon|45}} such as tempestblades.
Society.Relationships: Many were known to serve [[Yan-C-Bin]], the evil [[archomental]] of elemental air.{{cite book/Heroes of the Elemental Chaos|25, 28}} Beyond this, they often found themselves in the service [[storm titan]]s.
